description: From an south Eastern Algonquian language. Compare a Lenape gen'tke'n ("to sing, dance, etc.") as well  as Powhatan kantokan (“dance”) and kantikanti (“dance and sing”).

entries.meaning: A sacred ceremony of the Algonquin tribe that involved dancing in a circle, at which colonists were not welcome.
A dance festival in which colonial Americans and natives both participated.
(by extension) An uproar; activity that is full of high spirits and violent action.
